title: The Orphan Crisis
description: A 60-second lesson on The Orphan Crisis.

hook.text: Victorian London had over 100,000 homeless children living on its streets.

buildup.text: Industrial cities exploded in population. Disease, poverty, and workplace deaths created waves of orphans.

discovery.text: Orphanages were built at massive scale â€” warehousing children in conditions that often worsened their fate.

twist.text: Studies of Romanian orphanages centuries later confirmed what those children lived: institutional care damages brains.

climax.text: The orphan crisis eventually shifted policy toward foster care and adoption â€” family-based solutions.

punchline.text: Warehousing children was never care. It took centuries to see that.
